title.narrative: GENDER INTEGRATION

description.narrative: Strategies to address gender issues related to child rights are developed and integrated across programme, which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Prevention Of Harmful Practice (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Country programme is efficiently designed, coordinated, managed and supported to meet quality programming standards in achieving results for children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strategies to address gender issues related to child rights are developed and integrated across programme

description.narrative: ACO continued to demonstrate a gender commitment to programming for better results across Afghanistan Country Office’s priority areas of intervention and provided a special focus in programming especially technical support to sections for integrating gender equality and empowerment of women and girls.; Setting up of 13 Women and girls friendly spaces in communities became instrumental to provide alternative platform to women and girls voice, including their access to life saving information and services post 15 August, when the humanitarian catastrophe in Afghanistan gender specific restrictions to women and girls.;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
